subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Key Distribution Problem
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Key Distribution Problem.

hook.text: You have a perfect lock. But how do you give someone the key without anyone else copying it?

buildup.text: Symmetric encryption has a fatal flaw: both parties need the same key. Sharing it securely is incredibly hard.

discovery.text: Before the internet, keys were delivered by trusted couriers in locked briefcases. That doesn't scale.

twist.text: This problem seemed unsolvable for thousands of years. Then in 1976, two Stanford professors changed everything.

climax.text: The key distribution problem drove the invention of public-key cryptography â€” the internet's backbone.

punchline.text: The hardest problem in crypto isn't math. It's logistics.

quiz.question: What is the key distribution problem?
options: Keys are too expensive to produce
Safely sharing a secret key between parties is extremely difficult
